definition: system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: Full-time study form, system for three years.
sentences.chinese: 全日制學習形式，學制三年。

sentences.english: One of educational system reforms is implementing flexible educational system, students have benefited from it.
sentences.chinese: 彈性學制給學生帶來了益處，是高等教育改革的方向。

sentences.english: Since the primary school changed five years to six years, the primary school teachers have become less and less.
sentences.chinese: 小學學制實行“五改六”後，小學教師缺額甚大。

sentences.english: In fact, two years'teaching plan can not allow you to do all of this each class.
sentences.chinese: 實際上學制兩年的語文課也無法做到課課都這樣。

sentences.english: Ella pours in the chemicals and begins agitating the tank.
sentences.chinese: 埃拉倒進化學制劑，然後用力攪動桶裏的液體。

sentences.english: Usefulness of liquid-based preparation in urine cytology.
sentences.chinese: 液基細胞學制備尿液標本的作用。

sentences.english: The State establishes a scientific schooling system.
sentences.chinese: 國家建立科學的學制系統。

definition: student of a senior high school

pinyin: Xi1 an1 Jiao1 tong1 Da4 xue2

definition: public/publicly (owned, financed, operated etc)/run by the state

pinyin: Bei3 jing1 Wai4 guo2 yu3 Da4 xue2
